lead_paragraph: CLUNN--Andrew, died peacefully at The Osborn in Rye, NY on February 2, 2016. He was born in Kent, England in 1928, and came to New York in 1951 while working for Matson Navigation Company. In 1963 he became an apprentice to David Webb, the famous jeweler, with whom he worked for 12 years as a salesman, and then director of sales, becoming Webb's right-hand man working with the Duchess of Windsor, Elizabeth Taylor, and Diana Vreeland, among others. Following Webb's death in 1975, Andrew moved back to England. In 1980 he opened his own atelier, Andrew Clunn Ltd., on Madison Avenue in New York where he was a private jeweler and designer creating unique and distinctive jewelry for some of the most distinguished families in Europe and North America. Andrew's stylish designs became a favorite among prominent women in society and fashion. There are no known survivors, other than his many devoted friends. At Andrew's request, there will be no services. Memorial contributions may be made in the name of Andrew Clunn to the following organizations he supported during his lifetime: The Bideawee Home Association of New York; the ASPCA of New York; The Mabel Mercer Foundation; Carnegie Hall; and, WMNR Fine Arts Radio, Monroe, Connecticut. 1/3
